text: Gonzalo Segundo Córdova y Rivera (July 15, 1863 - April 13, 1928) was President of Ecuador from 1924-1925. Like his immediate predecessors in the Liberal Party, he was considered to be a pawn of "La Argolla" ring"), a plutocracy of coastal agricultural and banking interests whose linchpin was the Commercial and Agricultural Bank of Guayaquil led by Francisco Urbina Jado. ==Other websites== * Library of Congress country studies, Ecuador * List of leaders of Ecuador at worldstatesmen.org Category:1863 births Category:1928 deaths Category:Presidents of Ecuador Category:Politicians from Quito
title: Gonzalo Córdova
